titleStmt.title: Sir John Hothams letter to a worthy Member of the House of Commons, concerning the late discovery at Hull together with Master Beckwiths letter, a recusant, to Lievtenant Fooks his sonne in law, in service at Hull, under Sir John Hothams command, who was a great actor in that dangerous businesse.
titleStmt.author: Hotham, John, Sir, d. 1645 Jan. 2.

titleStmt.title: Sir John Hothams letter to a worthy Member of the House of Commons, concerning the late discovery at Hull together with Master Beckwiths letter, a recusant, to Lievtenant Fooks his sonne in law, in service at Hull, under Sir John Hothams command, who was a great actor in that dangerous businesse.
titleStmt.author: Hotham, John, Sir, d. 1645 Jan. 2.
Beckwith, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Husbands, and are to be sold at the next door to the Kings-Head in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: The "discovery" refers to a plot to surrender the town of Hull to the King.
"The true copy of Master Beckwiths letter, a recusant" is signed T.B., [i.e. Thomas Beckwith].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
